lexUnit.name: astride.prep
lexUnit.definition: FN: with one extreme part on each side of.

sentence.text: Similar protestations were no doubt uttered by Billy The Kid whenever he was discovered astride a corpse holding a smoking gun .
And when the great beast stopped to answer a call of nature , I felt as if I was sitting astride Mount Pinatubo .
Originally a Celtic nature-goddess , depicted as a woman astride a mare , or a woman 's torso with a horse 's head .
They were astride a single horse , tied back to back , being led along a skyline by the sheriff 's posse .
Was he Death astride his dark charger , was Death the moment of consummation , the moment of glory ?
He swung himself astride the dragon awkwardly , because Rincewind was hanging on to his belt .
He sat astride a ladder-backed wooden chair , his legs splayed out in front of him .
Excavations at the south-east gate astride the Dorchester road have suggested that its stone semi-circular tower was an integral part of these early defences .
Iceland , astride the Mid-Atlantic Ridge , provides an excellent example .
Arlington Mill , in this picturesque Cotswold village astride the River Coln , has been both a corn and fulling mill in its time .
The ancient town of Bridgwater , astride the River Parrett , is an ideal touring centre .
The Lakes sit astride the US-Canadian frontier , forming the world 's largest body of fresh water .
The only part to survive was a later addition to the original building , a warehouselike structure placed in front of and astride the main entrance .

Entering behind Miss Merchiston , Theda beheld a huge four-poster bed , its curtains fully open , the inhabitant of which was largely obscured by a black , woolly-haired mongrel standing astride her legs , apparently disputing Araminta 's right of entry .
The Corporal was still on the wall , all credit to him , legs astride as if he was riding a motorbike .
The marquis pinned her to the ground by her shoulders , sitting astride her so that she could n't move .
By then the BEF was astride the ridge originally occupied by the Germans .
He was still sitting astride the bike , balancing it with his long , lean legs tautly encased in black leather .
Sitting astride one of the beams that spanned the ceiling was Tessel .
When the humble outrider astride his saddle bags , goes his rounds for fresh orders , to dealers and chapmen in the country
The Arch of Trajan in Ancona ( A.D. 113 ) was set up at the harbour entrance astride a causeway .
Cinzia brought them both large measures of whisky and sat down astride the wicker chair in front of the writing desk , facing him over the ridged wooden back . <pb n=170>
Other characters who exist astride their primary source are more difficult to analyse .
Additionally , bargaining is a closed , private activity which sits uneasily astride the current emphasis on open government and public participation .
